revised_title: Encounter with the Tall Patagonians of Magellan
tldr: In 1764, a British expedition led by Commodore Byron encountered a tribe of very tall people near the Strait of Magellan. The Patagonians were described as having a copper-like skin, long black hair, and standing up to nine feet tall. The encounter provided valuable insights into the appearance and lifestyle of these indigenous people, but also highlighted the cultural differences and communication barriers between the two groups.
